intro: Hieracium hafsloense, commonly known as the Hafsloense hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, basal leaves. Native to parts of Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other sunny, dry environments.
